Forgot to throw in Downton Abbey. It's streamable on Netflix.  Amazingly high production value for tv... but of course it's British.  If you like some historical fiction, period dramas, and smart political shows... this is a MUST see.
Not in order of preference: Big Bang, American Pickers, Top Gear(UK version), Modern Family and Downton Abbey. BTW the next season of Downton is in production.

Btw, same goes for shows like Simpsons, Futurama, Family Guy, Southpark, etc… I just can't give them my precious time even though I do enjoy them once in a while. The shows I love I watch every season, every episode. With those, I just know I can't so I don't bother… :p

#1 The Big Bang Theory, #2 House MD, #3 Fringe, #4 Top Gear (UK) and #5 is shared between V and Outsourced V. Waiting for me to start or resume watching are: Mad Men, Lie to Me, Community, 30 Rock and HIMYM. All-time favorites include ARRESTED DEVELOPMENT <3, LOST and Flash Forward. 

PS: I do enjoy CSI and most law/cop shows but I can't get myself to dedicate time to them. I can barely watch the ones I do enjoy, let alone anything else…
Mad Men, Human Target, Survivor, South Park & Modern Family

That said House is really good. Difficult to choose between Community & Arr Dev since they're both so brilliant. Breaking Bad is by far the best show I've ever seen; overall. So damn good. Can't wait for Season 4.
